requirement.topic: XmlBlaster supports native client server communication in the same JVM

description.p: It is possible to start xmlBlaster clients with the runlevel manager of xmlBlaster. Like this the client is started on xmlBlaster startup in the same JVM as the server in a configurable sequence with other services (see our runlevel manager requirement).

If a client connects to XmlBlaster with the XmlBlasterAccess client interface it can choose the communication protocol like Corba, SOCKET, XmlRpc and more. But if the client runs in the same JVM we can avoid the communication over a socket by choosing the LOCAL protocol plugin. This improves speed and avoids using OS resources like ports and threads.
Switching the protocol is just a configuration setting, so any existing client can choose to communicate locally. Note that the client must implement the I_Plugin interface to be loadable as a plugin, this is described in the engine.runlevel requirement.

configuration.p: On client side we need to register the LOCAL protocol plugin to be available in the Java client library.

tr.td: Specify the plugin to get support of direct client/server communication in the same JVM
